#Parser and Models for Joint Morphologic and Dependency Parsing

== Parser and Models for Joint Tagging and Dependency Parsing  ==

This parser provides the following technology: transition-based dependency parser, beam-search and early update, graph-based completion model, joint Part-of-Speech tagging, joint Morphologic tagging, Hash-Kernel

  *  *Download* of joint parser:  [https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B-qbj-8rtoUMbVEzWDlvd0ZxVFU/edit?usp=sharing transition-1.30.jar]   and a change log to previous version:  [https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B-qbj-8rtoUMem9pVEoxYUNVYzg/edit?usp=sharing log]
  *  Old versions with compatible models: [https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B-qbj-8rtoUMMlpQSGtRcmxLSms/edit?usp=sharing transition-1.29.jar] [https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B-qbj-8rtoUMaEN5ZHhhN1JXMkk/edit?usp=sharing transition-1.28.jar] [https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B-qbj-8rtoUMRHByX0NBMTk2TlE/edit?usp=sharing transition-1.26.jar], [https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B-qbj-8rtoUMX3p3UjhfWlVRTXM/edit?usp=sharing transition-1.24.jar]
  * * New! - experimental version* with selected feature template sets for different language [https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B-qbj-8rtoUMWmJ5bnhZN0NVZG8/view?usp=sharing transition-62.jar] 

  The version is based on the paper of 

  Miguel Ballesteros and Bernd Bohnet   2014.   Automatic Feature Selection for Agenda-Based Dependency Parsing . 25th International Conference on Computational Linguistics (COLING 2014) Dublin, Ireland [http://anthology.aclweb.org/C/C14/C14-1076.pdf pdf]
  * *Sample Code* for integration into other java-code: [https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B-qbj-8rtoUMenh3VllFVUYtbDg/edit?usp=sharing LemmatizeAndParse.java]
  * Terms of use: research only (GPL), please cite: 
     _Bernd Bohnet, Joakim Nivre, Igor Boguslavsky, Richárd Farkas, Filip Ginter, Jan Hajic: Joint Morphological and Syntactic Analysis for Richly Inflected Languages. TACL 1: 415-428 (2013)_ [http://www.transacl.org/wp-content/uploads/2013/10/paperno34.pdf pdf] 
  * Commercial license and consulting is available, please contact {{{Bernd Bohnet}}}
